result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J. Riedel

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No contact with Officer Putzy.
No violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

11:16 AM case called. Judge John Manydeeds for Branch 3 Intake.
Prosecuting Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant David J. Riedel appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Francis Rivard with Eau Claire County Jail.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing. 
Defendant updates their address and phone number with the Court.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/21/2022 at 2:30 PM
Hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
